com.yantra.api.ycp.task

Interface changeTask

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    YIFApi, com.yantra.api.YSCApi

    public interface changeTask

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document changeTask(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The changeTask API takes in the values from an entire input XML file for an updated task and determines what has been changed and then incorporates those changes.

    • Method Detail

      • changeTask

        org.w3c.dom.Document changeTask(YFSEnvironment env,
                                org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                         throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                java.rmi.RemoteException
        The changeTask API takes in the values from an entire input XML file for an updated task and determines what has been changed and then incorporates those changes. Status change of tasks which were held due to partial deposit to any status other than InProgress status is prevented. This is prevented even if change Task is called internally from some other API. Modification rules are defined at activity group level. Modifications supported for each task group type are explained below.

        PUTAWAY/RETRIEVAL:
        Only Open(1100) or Suggested(1200) or In Progress(1300) tasks can be passed to this API.

        Validations: The following attributes are not allowed to change.
        ReceiptHeaderKey
        SegmentType
        WaveNo
        ShipmentNo
        ShipmentKey
        ShipmentContainerKey
        OrderHeaderKey
        OrderNo
        OrderReleaseKey
        OrderLineKey
        ReleaseNo
        PrimeLineNo
        SubLineNo
        MoveRequestKey
        MoveRequestLineKey
        MoveRequestNo
        SourceCaseId
        SourcePalletId
        TargetZoneId

        Error Codes:
        YFS10415: Key Fields can not be modified. This means that, the user has attempted to change one of the above specified attributes.

        Inventory updates: If the quantity passed is less than the original quantity and no action is passed, then the original task will be split into two tasks, where the changes will be applied to the original task with new quantity and a new task will be created with (Original quantity - quantity passed) and the values of all other attributes will remain unaffected as before calling this API. If action passed is 'CANCEL', the inventory allocated against the passed quantity will be de-allocated and all the changes will be applied to the remaining quantity.

        OUTBOUND PICKING:
        Only Open(1100) or Suggested(1200) or In Progress(1300) tasks can be passed to this API.

        Validations: The following attributes are not allowed to change.
        ReceiptHeaderKey
        SegmentType
        WaveNo
        ShipmentNo
        ShipmentKey
        ShipmentContainerKey
        OrderHeaderKey
        OrderNo
        OrderReleaseKey
        OrderLineKey
        ReleaseNo
        PrimeLineNo
        SubLineNo
        SourceAisle
        SourceLocationId
        SourceZoneId

        Error Codes:
        YFS10415: Key Fields can not be modified. This means that, the user has attempted to change one of the above specified attributes.

        Inventory updates: If the quantity passed is less than the original quantity and no action is passed, then the original task will be split into two tasks, where the changes will be applied to the original task with new quantity and a new task will be created with (Original quantity - quantity passed) and the values of all other attributes will remain unaffected as before calling this API. If action passed is 'CANCEL', the inventory allocated against the passed quantity will be de-allocated and all the changes will be applied to the remaining quantity.

        COUNT:
        Only Open(1100) or Suggested(1200) or In Progress(1300) tasks can be passed to this API.

        Validations: The following attributes are not allowed to change.
        ReceiptHeaderKey
        SegmentType
        WaveNo
        ShipmentNo
        ShipmentKey
        ShipmentContainerKey
        OrderHeaderKey
        OrderNo
        OrderReleaseKey
        OrderLineKey
        ReleaseNo
        PrimeLineNo
        SubLineNo
        CountRequestKey
        CountRequestNo
        SourceCaseId
        SourcePalletId
        SourceAisle
        SourceLocationId
        SourceZoneId

        Error Codes:
        YFS10415: Key Fields can not be modified. This means that, the user has attempted to change one of the above specified attributes.

        Validation for TaskType change:
        changeTask API supports changing of TaskType if and only if:
        1. The old TaskType and new TaskType are exactly same except the ExecutionDevice and EquipmentType.
        For Example: TaskType1 uses equipment EQUIP1 and TaskType2 uses equipment EQUIP2. The API allows change of TaskType from TaskType1 to TaskType2 only if rest of the configuration for both the task types is same. Same holds good for EquipmentDevice.
        2. The old TaskType and new TaskType are exactly same except the picking type.
        For Example: TaskType1 is configured to pick into equipment and TaskType2 is configured to pick into inventory container. The API allows change of TaskType from TaskType1 to TaskType2 only if rest of the configuration for both the task types is same.
        Note: If this API is used to change the TaskType of a task that is included in a batch, the user has to ensure that the TaskType of the remainder of the tasks in that batch is also changed to the same TaskType. In such a scenario changeBatch is a better API to use.
        Error Code:
        YFS10415: Key Fields can not be modified. This means that, the user has attempted to change TaskType that voilates the above requirement.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        Validations:
        Inventory:

          Quantity:
          Optional. Adding quantity to a task is not allowed. If the quantity is more than task quantity then error is thrown. If quantity is less than task quantity and action is passed is not 'CANCEL' then all the changes are applied to only that much quantity. Rest of the quantity belongs to old values. In this case task gets split. If action passed is 'CANCEL' and quantity passed is less than task quantity then quantity passed to the api will be canceled.

        User Exits: This user exit is called before executing any business logic. If input xml needs to be changed for any reason or any processing has to be done before executing the API, this can be done by this user exit. com.yantra.ycp.japi.ue.YCPBeforeChangeTaskUE

        Events Raised:

        Task Changed:

          This event is raised when task is changed.
          Data published - YCP_CHANGE_TASK.TASK_CHANGED.xml
          Key data - task_dbd.txt

        Task Put On Hold:

          This event is raised when task is put up on hold.
          Data published - YCP_CHANGE_TASK.TASK_PUT_ON_HOLD.xml
          Key data - task_dbd.txt

        Task Released From Hold:

          This event is raised when task is released from hold.
          Data published - YCP_CHANGE_TASK.TASK_RELEASED_FROM_HOLD.xml
          Key data - task_dbd.txt

        Template Support: Yes

        Audits: Yes

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.
        Returns:
        An XML document having latest task details and the audit details made to the task status on the platform. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
